definition: to join things together by fixing them in place at one or more points/to nail/to pin/to staple/to sew on
nail/to follow closely/to keep at sb (to do sth)/variant of 盯[ding1]

sentences.english: Think studs and a pearl necklace, if you must wear jewelry.
sentences.chinese: 如果你必须戴首饰，就考虑耳钉和珍珠项链。

sentences.english: The heart-shaped studs in clear crystal pavé will make your heart melt.
sentences.chinese: 心形透明密镶水晶耳钉足以让你心动。

sentences.english: I showed Jill the earring, and she admitted it was hers.
sentences.chinese: 我给Jill看了我发现的耳钉，她承认是她的。

sentences.english: Ellen’s ears glow with diamond earrings.
sentences.chinese: Ellen耳垂上的钻石耳钉闪闪发光。
一条项链，一只戒指，还有耳钉。

sentences.english: A gold-plated chain attaches them to two bezel-set clear crystal studs.
sentences.chinese: 镀金色饰链衔接在包边镶嵌通明水晶耳钉上。

sentences.english: Selection of high quality earrings, on the Park Road Cikuan heart-shaped diamond highlights show.
sentences.chinese: 高品质的耳钉精选，就在朴道此款心形加亮水钻呈现。

sentences.english: His trademark earrings were gone and so was the arrogant manner of the past.
sentences.chinese: 他标志性的耳钉和之前的傲慢态度通通都不见了。

sentences.english: Pierce an earring on the webbed part between the thumb and the forefinger.
sentences.chinese: 在大拇指与食指中间像鸭蹼的地方穿孔戴上耳钉。
